page.title: 03Farming around Cliffe
page.content:
The main farming around Cliffe is growing{cereals.}Over half of the fields are being used for barley, with some winter wheat and oats. Most of the barley is grown for malting. In the survey we counted five fields of sugar beet, five fields of oil seed rape, four fields of potatoes, and one field of beans.
There are two{pig farms}in the area, one just west of Cliffe, and one on Cliffe Common. There are two{dairy {farms,}Wood End Farm, and Nevilthorne, both with herds of Friesians.
There are two{market gardens}in the area, growing mainly lettuce, and tomatoes in greenhouses. Old people can remember when there was a lot more market gardening, and the plants went on the railway to Leeds or Hull.
